column3:
Nak. :( 

Logging IPs of identifying things by default would make it profitable to go around breaking into nodes in order to backtrace announcements.

However, I'd ack a non-default option to log IPs for blocks (and other things too) though.
NACK - this makes it valuable to collect debug.log from user's systems to trace transactions/blocks back to IP Addresses, which should not be trivial.\n

NACK.

RE: making it optional:  maybe -blocknotify could optionally pass the IP into the notification method.

Since it seems people are getting the wrong impression from this pullreq...\n\nIt was proposed by a pool member who noticed the mystery jerk miner (making transactionless blocks) was relaying them through Eligius. This handy-but-simple change enabled me to get the real IP of the actual server making these blocks. The objections given herein by other developers are logical concerns, and I have no q
